channel.title: Azure Updates Feed
channel.description: Currently the Azure Updates page has no RSS enabled - this is a temp feed made by scraping that page for updates

item.title: Retirement: Older versions of EA Azure Price Sheet – Download by Billing Account API
item.description: All versions of the EA Azure Price Sheet - Download by Billing Account API prior to version 2023-09-01 will be retired on June 1, 2026. Please migrate to version 2023-11-01 to take advantage of the newer and enhanced price sheet.

item.title: Generally Available: App Service Environment memory intensive pricing tier
item.description: New cost-effective solution for apps that need more memory resources without extra cores on Azure App Service Environment v3.

item.title: Generally Available: Storage account default egress limit increase to 200 Gbps
item.description: The default maximum egress for general-purpose v2 and Blob storage accounts has been increased to 200 Gbps in regions where the limit was previously 120 Gbps.

item.title: Retirement: Announcing upcoming retirement of custom text analytics for health (preview) in Azure AI Language
item.description: Support for custom text analytics for health (preview) in Azure AI Language is ending on January 10th, 2025

item.title: Retirement: Announcing upcoming retirement of custom sentiment analysis (preview) in Azure AI Language
item.description: Support for custom sentiment analysis (preview) in Azure AI Language is ending on January 10th, 2025

item.title: Generally Available: Several performance management server parameters now modifiable on Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description: Configure a new set of server parameters for performance management—now modifiable in Azure Database for PostgreSQL — Flexible Server.

item.title: Public Preview: vCore-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB—up to 32 TiB storage
item.description: Get up to 32 TiB and up to 20,000 IOPS per physical shard for larger workloads.

item.title: Public Preview: vCore-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB multishard, cross-region replication
item.description: Cross-region replication on multishard clusters enables disaster recovery and read scalability for larger workloads.

item.title: Public Preview: vCore-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB multishard clusters
item.description: Support larger workloads and get improved performance with mMultishard vCore-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB clusters.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server—support for postgresql_anonymizer extension version 1.3.2
item.description: Get support for the postgresql_anonymizer extension, also known as the anon extension—now available in version 1.3.2. This extension helps mask or anonymize sensitive data directly within your database, providing an extra layer of data protection.

item.title: Public Preview: DiskANN indexing on Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description: Use one of the fastest vector indexing algorithms for enhanced retrieval performance and accuracy in Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

item.title: Generally Available: Redis 7.2 on Azure Cache for Redis Enterprise
item.description: Use an updated version of Redis on your cache instances.

item.title: Generally Available: Dedicated gateway RBAC support and a new request option
item.description: Authenticate requests to the dedicated gateway using role-based access control (RBAC) and have more control over what data is cached with a new request option to bypass the integrated cache.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server flexible maintenance
item.description: Easily reschedule maintenance—and automate using Azure CLI—within a maximum 30-day window.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer custom column selector and filter history
item.description: Easily customize Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer views using new custom column selector and filter history.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure SQL updates for early-October 2024
item.description: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in early-October 2024.

item.title: Generally Available: ExpressRoute guided configuration experience
item.description: ExpressRoute's multi-site resiliency ensures businesses achieve maximum reliability and redundancy by providing multiple layers of connectivity protection across diverse geographic locations. This robust setup minimizes downtime and enhances operational continuity, making it ideal for enterprises requiring consistent and secure network performance.

item.title: Generally Available: Private endpoint support without NVA source network address translation
item.description: Azure Private Endpoint traffic will no longer require source network address translation on customer's NVA to prevent Asymmetric Routing.

item.title: Retirement: End of Support Announcement for Azure Load Balancer numberOfProbes property on September 1, 2027.
item.description: Support for Azure Load Balancer numberOfProbes property is ending

item.title: Generally Available: Custom IPv4 Prefixes (BYOIP) can be used in a Global/Regional configuration
item.description: You can now bring a “global” BYOIP range to azure that can be divided into multiple “regional” ranges across multiple Azure regions

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Application Gateway v2 Basic SKU
item.description: Designed for customers, especially developers or small enterprises who are looking for a cost-effective Application Load Balancer solution and don’t require high scalability and advanced features.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Spring Apps will be retired on March 31, 2028
item.description: Plan out your migration from Azure Spring Apps to Azure Container Apps.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Diagnostic Extensions set to Retire in 18 months
item.description: Start using the Azure Monitor Agent instead of the Azure Diagnostics Agent before March 31st, 2026.

item.title: Generally Available: Reminder New E-mail templates for Log search alerts - API version 2021-08-01 and up
item.description: As we continue to enhance your experience with Azure Monitor, we want to remind you about an important update of Log search alerts V2 non common scheme e-mail templates.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Sphere is retiring Legacy service interfaces on September 27th, 2027
item.description: Azure Sphere (Legacy) service interfaces will be retired on September 27th, 2027 – plan your migration to Azure Sphere (Integrated).

item.title: Public Preview: Switch to Azure Business Continuity Center for at scale BCDR management
item.description: Take advantage of Azure Business Continuity (ABC) Center, a streamlined, centralized management center that simplifies backup and disaster recovery across various environments (Azure, Hybrid) and solutions (Azure Backup and Azure Site Recovery).

item.title: Generally Available: Save up to 56% on the latest Linux VMs in most Azure regions for a limited time
item.description: Save an additional 15% discount on 1-year Azure Reserved Virtual Machine Instance rates for the latest Linux VMs. Offer valid from October 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Virtual Network IP address management
item.description: Announcing the preview of the new Azure Virtual Network Manager feature, enhancing your network management capability.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure NVads V710 v5-series virtual machines
item.description: The NVads V710 v5-series virtual machines are powered by AMD Radeon Pro V710 GPUs and AMD EPYC 9V64 (Genoa) CPUs, providing five VM sizes from 1/6 to a full V710 GPU with NVMe support for ephemeral local storage. These VMs are ideal for demanding GPU-accelerated graphics applications, cloud-based virtual desktops, high-quality gaming experiences, and small to medium AI/ML inference workloads

item.title: Public Preview: Azure NMads MA35D-Series virtual machines
item.description: The Azure NMads MA35D-Series virtual machines (VM) are now in public preview in the East US region, offering specialized hardware for optimized video transcoding workloads. This VM series provides higher throughput, lower latency, and access to modern codecs like AV1, making it an ideal choice for video transcoding on the cloud.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Backup- Reduced Protected Instance Fee for SAP HANA Backup
item.description: Azure Backup for SAP HANA Database Delivers More Value at Lower TCO with Reduced Protected Instance Fees starting Sept 1st, 2024

item.title: Retirement: SQL Data Sync will be retired on September 30th, 2027
item.description: Important Notice: Support for SQL Data Sync service will be retired on September 30th,2027.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Orbital Ground Station Retirement
item.description: Azure Orbital Ground Station (AOGS) will be retired on December 16th, 2024. This includes 1st party antenna support and 3rd party partner network scheduling capabilities.

item.title: Retirement: End of life for NCv3-series VM family support in Azure Batch pools
item.description: Support for NCv3-series VM family will be retired for Azure Batch pools on September 30th, 2025.

item.title: Retirement: Planned Service Retirement - Azure Automation State Configuration on September 30, 2027
item.description: This article contains important information about required actions related to the retirement of Azure Automation State Configuration on September 30, 2027.

item.title: Retirement: Information regarding the end of support for the "Microsoft Translator [DEPRECATED]" connector
item.description: The Microsoft Translator connector and its underlying API have been deprecated and will be disabled on Power Platform starting October 30, 2024. To avoid disruptions, transition to the Microsoft Translator V2 connector and Azure Text to Speech connector for the respective actions.

item.title: Retirement: Open Service Mesh extension for Arc-enabled Kubernetes will be retired on September 30, 2027
item.description: Plan out your migration for Open Service Mesh (OSM) to Istio.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Maps Spatial APIs V1 & 2022-08-01 will be retired on September 30th, 2025.
item.description: Azure Maps support for Azure Maps Spatial APIs V1 & 2022-08-01 will be retired on September 30th 2025

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Functions .NET 9 support in Linux plans
item.description: Azure Functions now supports .NET 9 preview 7, using the isolated worker model.

item.title: Retirement: Deprecation of Virtual Network Injection for Azure Data Explorer
item.description: The Virtual Network Injection feature for Azure Data Explorer is being deprecated due to its limitations and challenges. Customers are advised to migrate to a private endpoint-based network security architecture by February 1, 2025, to avoid any disruption

item.title: Public Preview: Introducing Reporting and Microsoft Entra ID Authentication for Microsoft Playwright Testing
item.description: We are excited to announce the public preview of Reporting and Microsoft Entra ID authentication for Microsoft Playwright Testing.

item.title: Public Preview: Virtual machines node pools support in AKS
item.description: You can now have multiple VM SKU in a node pool in AKS.

item.title: Retirement: Open Service Mesh add-on for AKS will be retired on September 30, 2027
item.description: Plan out your migration from Open Service Mesh (OSM) to Istio add-on for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

item.title: Generally Available: Long-term support for version 1.27 and 1.30 in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
item.description: You can now enable long-term support (LTS) for Kubernetes version 1.30.

item.title: Retirement: AKS GPU image (preview) will retire on Jan 10, 2025
item.description: Effective January 10, 2025, Azure Kubernetes Service will no longer support or provide updates to the GPU image.

item.title: Generally Available: FIPS mutability support in AKS
item.description: You can now enable or disable FIPS on an existing Linux node pool in AKS.

item.title: Generally Available: Extended support: PHP 8.1 on App Service
item.description: PHP 8.1 support is extending on App Service.

item.title: Retirement: Extended support for Python 3.9 ends October 2025 – upgrade your apps to Python 3.10
item.description: Support for Python 3.9 ends October 2025 upgrade apps to Python 3.10

item.title: Retirement: Extended support for PHP 8.2 ends December 31st, 2026 – upgrade apps to PHP 8.3
item.description: Support for PHP 8.2 ends December 31st, 2026, upgrade apps to PHP 8.3

item.title: Retirement: Azure Machine Learning data drift detection will retire on September 1st, 2025
item.description: Start using the Azure Machine Learning model monitoring instead of the Azure Machine Learning data drift detection before September 1st, 2025.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Cosmos DB dynamic scaling—per region and per partition autoscale
item.description: Optimize costs using the new dynamic scaling enhancement to autoscale for nonuniform workloads.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure confidential VMs with NVIDIA Tensor Core GPUs
item.description: VMs based on AMD 4th Gen EPYCTM processors with SEV-SNP technology paired with NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs.

item.title: Public Preview: New FX series VMs - FXmsv2 and FXmdsv2
item.description: The FXmsv2 and FXmdsv2 series are newest additions to the FX subfamily of VMs.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Load Balancer Inbound NAT rule V1 for Azure VMs and Azure VMSS will be retired
item.description: Migrate to Azure Load Balancer Inbound NAT rule V2 by September 30, 2027.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Front Door support for TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 will end by Dec 1st, 2024
item.description: The TLS versions 1.2 and later offer improved security with features such as perfect forward secrecy and stronger cipher suites.

item.title: Retirement: Azure CDN Standard from Microsoft (classic) will be retired on September 30th, 2027
item.description: Migrate to Azure Front Door Standard or Premium to avoid service disruptions.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Application Gateway support for TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 will end by 31 August 2025
item.description: The TLS versions 1.2 and later offer improved security with features such as perfect forward secrecy and stronger cipher suites.

item.title: Generally Available: gRPC and frontend mTLS now available for Application Gateway for Containers
item.description: Application Gateway for Containers now supports gRPC and frontend mutual authentication. With both frontend and backend mutual authentication, end-to-end mutual authentication is now possible.

item.title: Retirement: Intent Recognition an Azure AI Speech feature will be retired on September 30th, 2025
item.description: Intent Recognition an Azure AI Speech feature will be retired on September 30th, 2025.

item.title: Retirement: Network security group flow logs in Azure Network Watcher will be retired
item.description: Network security group flow logs in Azure Network Watcher will be retired on September 30th, 2027.

item.title: Retirement: Azure AI Speaker Recognition
item.description: Azure AI Speaker Recognition will be retired on September 30, 2025.

item.title: Retirement: Retirement of Classic Alerts for Azure Site Recovery
item.description: Classic Alerts for Azure Site Recovery is on a retirement journey. Migrate to an improved solution using Azure Monitor by Sept 23 2027.

item.title: Retirement: Conversation Transcription Multi Channel Diarization
item.description: Conversation Transcription Service provided speaker diarization with multichannel audio will be retired on March 28th ,2025.

item.title: Retirement: VpnGw1-5 (Non-AZ SKUs) will be retired on Sep 30, 2026 – gateways will be automatically migrated to AZ SKUs
item.description: Retirement notice: VPN Gateway Non-Availability Zone SKU (VpnGw 1-5)

item.title: Retirement: Transition from Helm Repositories to OCI Artifacts for Storing Helm Charts
item.description: Helm v2 reached end of life status in November 2020. Therefore, Azure Container Registry will end support for Helm v2 and Helm repositories on March 30th, 2025. Please transition to Helm v3 and store your Helm Charts as OCI Artifacts.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Automange Best Practices Migrating to Azure Policy
item.description: Azure Product Retirement: Azure Automanage Best Practices on 09/30/2027. Replace with Azure Policy.

item.title: Generally Available: V5 reservations for Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
item.description: Save up to 65% on V5 compute resources by using reserved capacity pricing.

item.title: Generally Available: Smaller Enterprise tier cache instance for Azure Cache for Redis
item.description: Take advantage of a lower cost option for your Redis workloads.

item.title: Generally Available: Online migration from Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Single Server to Flexible Server
item.description: Experience seamless online migration with minimal application downtime.

item.title: Generally Available: Latest PostgreSQL minor versions supported by Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
item.description: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 16.4, 15.8, 14.13, 13.16, 12.20, and 17 Beta 3.

item.title: Retirement: Microsoft Purview Data Sharing (in Public Preview) is retiring on September 26th, 2025
item.description: This post contains information about pre-retirement actions related to the retirement of Microsoft Purview Data Sharing.

item.title: Generally Available: Access-based enumeration and non-browsable shares for SMB and dual-protocol Azure NetApp Files volumes
item.description: Access-based enumeration and non-browsable shares for SMB and dual-protocol volumes in Azure NetApp Files is now generally available

item.title: Generally Available: Azure NetApp Files Reserved Capacity
item.description: Cost savings and improved financial predictability with Azure NetApp Files Reserved Capacity

item.title: Retirement: Azure Maps Creator Service APIs V2 & 2023-03-01-preview will be retired on September 30, 2025
item.description: Azure Maps support for Creator Services APIs V2 & 2023-03-01-preview will be retired on September 30, 2025

item.title: Generally Available: Force detach zone redundant data disks during zone outage
item.description: Customers will now be able to detach the ZRS data disks and attach them to another VM, decreasing the RTO.

item.title: Public Preview: Advanced Container Networking Services: Enhancing security and observability in AKS
item.description: Microsoft’s Azure container Networking team is announcing availability of FQDN filtering and HA DNS proxy within Advanced Container Networking Services on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). These new features provide a robust and secure solution for managing network traffic in containerized environments.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Remote Rendering will be retired on September 30th, 2025
item.description: Azure Remote Rendering will be retired on September 30th, 2025. Please plan to stop usage and delete your Remote Rendering account by September 30th, 2025.

item.title: Retirement: SQL Insights (preview)
item.description: SQL Insights (preview) will be retired on December 31, 2024.

item.title: Public Preview: Announcing Azure Monitor Metrics Export in public preview
item.description: We are excited to announce a new way of exporting platform metrics from Azure Monitor. This powerful addition allows customers to export metrics for their Azure resources on a large scale, with full fidelity and low latency, along with the ability to select particular metrics while configuring exports.

item.title: Generally Available: Automated Patching retirement and replacement with Azure Update Manager
item.description: Automated Patching retirement and replacement with Azure Update Manager.

item.title: Retirement: Support for PowerShell 7.2 on Azure Functions is ending on November 8, 2024
item.description: Support for PowerShell 7.2 on Azure Functions is ending soon. Your apps that are hosted on Azure Functions will continue to run, but security updates will no longer be available, and we’ll no longer provide customer service for PowerShell 7.2. Learn more about Azure Functions stack version support.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Data Box 80 TB is now Generally available at Azure China
item.description: General Availability of Azure Data Box 80 TB at Azure China

item.title: Retirement: Azure SQL Edge will be retired on September 30th, 2025
item.description: Azure SQL Edge will be retired on September 30, 2025. Upon retirement, workloads deployed to existing SQL Edge modules and containers will continue to run as-is; there will be no additional support provided for SQL Edge and no further updates will be published. We encourage you to consider migrating to an alternative solution prior to the retirement date to ensure a smooth transition to a fully supported product.

item.title: Retirement: Microsoft Genomics Service
item.description: Microsoft Genomics Service will be retired on January 6, 2025

item.title: Retirement: Azure Maps Data Registry APIs V 2023-06-01 will be retired on September 30th, 2025.
item.description: Azure Maps support for Azure Maps Data Registry APIs V 2023-06-01 will be retired on September 30th, 2025

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Site Recovery update rollup 75 – August 2024
item.description: This update also provides improvement and bug fixes.

item.title: Retirement: Azure AI Vision APIs to be retired
item.description: Azure AI Vision Image Analysis 4.0 Custom Image Classification, Custom Object Detection, Product Recognition and Segment (Background Removal) Preview APIs and Spatial Analysis Edge container to be retired.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Managed Confidential Consortium Framework (CCF) Service Support Ending on November 22nd, 2024
item.description: Azure Managed Azure Managed Confidential Consortium Framework Preview support is ending soon. Please migrate any resources to Azure Confidential Ledger.

item.title: Retirement: Azure PostgreSQL migration extension in Azure Data Studio (ADS)
item.description: The Azure PostgreSQL migration extension in Azure Data Studio is being retired to focus on more advanced and supported migration services within the Azure Database for PostgreSQL portal and CLI. This change ensures customers have access to up-to-date features for their migration needs.

item.title: Generally Available: Java on Azure Container Apps
item.description: Experience a new way to run Java applications on Azure Container Apps.

item.title: Public Preview: Low-Code RAG ingestion with built-in document parsing and chunking in Logic Apps Standard
item.description: We are thrilled to introduce the Public Preview of built-in actions for document parsing and chunking in Logic Apps Standard, designed to streamline RAG-based ingestion for Generative AI applications. With these out-of-the-box operations, you can now easily ingest documents or files, including both structured and unstructured data, into AI Search without writing or managing any code!

item.title: Private Preview: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs (Linux OS)
item.description: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs (Linux OS) is now available for private preview.

item.title: Public Preview: DNAT on Azure Firewall Private IP address
item.description: Azure Firewall enhances the Destination Network Address Translation (DNAT) rule configuration to support port translation on its Private IP address.

item.title: Retirement: Azure AI Document Intelligence GA API v2.1 is retiring on 15 September 2027
item.description: Azure AI Document Intelligence GA AI v2.1 will be retiring soon. Please migrate to newer API version to continue operation.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Web PubSub – MQTT support now available
item.description: Seamlessly deliver content over low-bandwidth, high latency, or unreliable networks.

item.title: Public Preview: Live Resize for Azure Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks
item.description: This feature is the ability to increase your Premium SSD v2 and Ultra disk storage capacity without stopping your VM.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Functions support for PowerShell 7.4
item.description: You can now take advantage of PowerShell 7.4 capabilities with your Functions apps.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure SQL Database Hyperscale elastic pools
item.description: Azure SQL Database Hyperscale elastic pools are now generally available.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure IoT Edge now supports new version releases of Ubuntu Server, Debian, and Yocto
item.description: IoT Edge now supports Ubuntu Server 24.04, Debian 12, and Yocto Scarthgap.

item.title: Retirement: Azure App Service Environment v1/v2 is retired as of August 31, 2024
item.description: This article contains important information about required actions and post-retirement activities related to the retirement of Azure App Service Environment v1/v2 on August 31, 2024.

item.title: Generally Available: Auto-renewal of certificates for on-premises to Azure Site Recovery
item.description: Auto-renewal of certificates for on-premises to Azure Site Recovery.

item.title: Public Preview: Expanded GenAI Gateway capabilities in Azure API Management
item.description: We are excited to announce new enhancements to our GenAI Gateway capabilities, specifically designed for large language model (LLM) use cases. Building on our initial release in May 2024, we are introducing new policies to support a wider range of LLMs via the Azure AI Model Inference API. These new policies offer the same robust functionality as our initial offerings but are now compatible with a broader array of models available in Azure AI Studio.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Container Storage enabled by Azure Arc Edge Volumes
item.description: Learn more about the Public Preview announcement of Azure Container Storage enabled by Azure Arc Edge Volumes.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Storage Mover with Bandwidth Management
item.description: Azure Storage Mover with WAN link bandwidth management schedules is now generally available.

item.title: Generally Available: VMSS Automatic Instance Repairs – Reimage, Restart Repair Actions
item.description: We are excited to announce that customers can now choose between Replace, Reimage (New), or Restart (New) as the default repair action performed in response to an "Unhealthy" application signal.

item.title: Public Preview – Templates Support in Azure Logic Apps Standard
item.description: We're excited to announce the Public Preview of Templates Support in Azure Logic Apps Standard, providing pre-built workflow solutions to streamline and accelerate integration projects. This new feature allows developers to quickly set up, customize, and deploy workflows, simplifying the process of building and managing applications.

item.title: Public Preview – Out of box monitoring dashboards for Logic Apps Standard
item.description: We’re excited to introduce Insights support for Azure Logic Apps Standard, offering curated visualizations to help you monitor your applications and workflows more effectively. With these new dashboards, you gain a comprehensive view of your Logic Apps Standard environments, enabling better oversight of your integration scenarios.

item.title: Public Preview: Entra ID support for SSH connections in portal
item.description: Entra ID support for SSH connections is now supported in the portal experience for a quicker, more secure, one click experience.

item.title: Retirement: Azure API Management STV1 compute platform is retired as of August 31, 2024
item.description: This article contains important information about required actions and post-retirement activities related to the retirement of Azure API Management stv1 on August 31, 2024.

item.title: Retirement: Azure Logic Apps Integration Service Environment is retired as of August 31, 2024
item.description: This article contains important information about required actions and post-retirement activities related to the retirement of Azure Logic Apps Integration Service Environment (ISE) on August 31, 2024.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Public IPs are zone redundant by default
item.description: Azure Public IPs are now zone redundant by default in 12 regions.
